page.title: 06Housing and Media
page.content: The houses at Knole Park Almondsbury were planned to take advantage of its elevated position, with detached houses in large gardens. The houses contain much of the stone from the original mansion so have a distinctive appearance. Many of the Pilning farm houses are well over 100 years old and built of grey stone with tiled roofs. One farm house is thought to be 700 years old and reputed to have been connected with smuggling from the Severn.Pilning has a ribbon development of old cottages now renovated on a road out of the village The area is well placed for television reception; the Welsh programmes as well as the English are received. Some daily newspapers are delivered. A parish magazine either Pilning or Olveston is delivered free. A mobile County library visits fortnightly.
